meta.project: Interactive Website with Smooth Scrolling and Particle Globe

product_overview: This project is an interactive, multi-language website built with TypeScript and Next.js, featuring smooth scrolling, rich animations, a particle globe visualization, and a responsive design optimized for desktop and mobile devices.
core_goals: Provide seamless smooth scrolling experience synchronized with GSAP animations for engaging user interactions.
Deliver a responsive navigation system supporting Korean and English languages with accessibility features.
Showcase platform's vision, key features, and economic model using modern design effects like glassmorphism and SVG visuals.
Ensure performance optimization across devices, including mobile, maintaining high frame rates and visual fidelity.
Maintain high accessibility standards and SEO rankings through semantic markup and keyboard navigation support.
key_features: Global smooth scrolling using Lenis integrated with GSAP ScrollTrigger.
Responsive navigation header with sticky behavior, language toggle (KO/EN), and mobile drawer with outside-click close functionality.
High-density particle globe rendered on Canvas in the Hero section with animated intros and continent highlighting.
Vision & Value section with premium glassmorphism effects and scroll-triggered fade animations.
Bento grid layout showcasing key platform features with hover effects.
Interactive mobile mockup in 'How It Moves' section with tab navigation and optimized screen transitions.
Economic model representation using glassmorphism cards with custom SVG icons.
Multi-language support implemented via React Context for Korean and English translations.
Footer with corporate info, accessible social links, and scroll-to-top button.
user_flow_summary: User lands on the homepage, greeted by the animated particle globe hero section with smooth scroll engagement.
User navigates through sections featuring Vision & Value, Bento Grid features, How It Moves mobile mockup, and Economy & Revenue Share.
User switches languages seamlessly via header language toggle, with layout and text adapting accordingly.
User interacts with responsive navigation menu and mobile drawer, which supports accessible keyboard navigation and closes on outside clicks.
User explores footer for corporate contact details and uses scroll-to-top functionality.
Animations remain synchronized and fluid during scroll, optimized for both desktop and mobile devices.
validation_criteria: Verify smooth scrolling implementation with Lenis and GSAP triggers do not jitter or desynchronize.
Confirm mobile performance, ensuring particle globe canvas maintains near 60FPS on low-end devices.
Test responsiveness across devices especially small screens (320-375px) ensuring text and grid remain readable without overflow.
Validate glassmorphism contrast ratio for text legibility over patterned backgrounds.
Ensure no scroll locking issues on mobile when navigation menu is open.
Check language switch does not break layouts or cause misaligned text or UI elements.
Confirm accessibility compliance: keyboard navigation, meaningful alt texts, aria-labels, and logical tab order.
Test cross-browser compatibility including iOS Safari for backdrop-filter and canvas transparency issues.
Validate font loading to prevent layout shifts and flicker.
Ensure memory leaks are prevented by proper cleanup of GSAP contexts on page transitions.
